definition: prefix used before the surname of a person or a numeral indicating the order of birth of the children in a family or to indicate affection or familiarity/old (of people)/venerable (person)/experienced/of long standing/always/all the time/of the past/very/outdated/(of meat etc) tough
to practice/to train/to drill/to perfect (one's skill)/exercise/(literary) white silk/to boil and scour raw silk

sentences.english: He is sophisticated enough to laugh things off and let bygones be bygones.
sentences.chinese: 他成熟老練，對事一笑了之，既往不咎。

sentences.english: The effect of aging voltage on the capacitance and leakage current of al electrolytic capacitors.
sentences.chinese: 老練電壓對鋁電解電容器容量和漏電流的影響。

sentences.english: In their opinions, people who change their jobs frequently are superficial and tactless .
sentences.chinese: 他們看來，經常更換職業的人淺薄，不老練。

sentences.english: That changes and as people's concept of time becomes more sophisticated, so does the quality of their coping," Thurber said.
sentences.chinese: 那樣的變化與人們的時間觀念一樣，變得越發的老練。

sentences.english: She is such a sophisticated woman that she saw through his trick at the first sight.
sentences.chinese: 她是個十分老練的女人，她一眼就看穿了他的把戲。

sentences.english: To the seasoned campaigner, the remarks of hecklers were like water off a duck's back.
sentences.chinese: 對老練的競選者來說，質問者的話有如耳邊風。

sentences.english: American Riflemen receive longer range sticky bombs ability at Vet level 2.
sentences.chinese: 美軍步槍兵2級老練時粘性炸彈技能射程增加。

sentences.english: The aged Sith Lord was able to outmaneuver Kenobi, and knocked the seasoned Jedi unconscious.
sentences.chinese: 年邁的西斯尊主智勝克諾比，把這位老練的絕地打昏。
這些年來他變得老練了。

sentences.english: That's why experienced mediocrity almost always trumps talent every time.
sentences.chinese: 這就是爲何老練的平庸幾乎每每勝過才華。

sentences.english: Dad's certainly grown mellower with age.
sentences.chinese: 隨着年齡的增長，父親當然是更老練了。

sentences.english: The attack appears to have been the work of a sophisticated individual or group.
sentences.chinese: 這次的攻擊似乎是一個老練的個體或者團體做的。

sentences.english: "A skillful photographer can photograph anything well, " he once insisted.
sentences.chinese: “老練的攝影師什麼都可以拍，”他曾堅持道。

sentences.english: Governments are becoming more sophisticated owners.
sentences.chinese: 政府正在變成更加老練的國企掌握者。

sentences.english: Purple evokes sophistication, spirituality, costliness, royalty and mystery.
sentences.chinese: 紫色使人聯想到世故老練，心靈，奢侈，皇室及神祕。

definition: variant of 矇騙|蒙骗[meng1 pian4]
lit. you hoodwink me and I cheat you (idiom); fig. mutual deception/each tries to outwit the other/dog eats dog and devil take the hindmost
universally shocking/to offend the whole of society
properly/satisfactorily/firmly/very fitting/appropriate/proper/to be in good order/also written 妥帖
to uphold (e.g. justice or virtue)/to promote
